verses.text_plain: When a man hath taken a wife, and married her, and it come to pass that she find no favour in his eyes, because he hath found some uncleanness in her: then let him write her a bill of divorcement, and give it in her hand, and send her out of his house.
verses.verse_html:
1When a man hath taken a wife, and married her, and it come to pass that she find no favour in his eyes, because he hath found some uncleanness in her: then let him write her a bill of divorcement, and give it in her hand, and send her out of his house. ▼
▼ some…: Heb. matter of nakedness
 , ▼
▼ divorcement: Heb. cutting off

tokens.text: her, and it come to pass that she find
in her: then let him write

footnotes.body_html: ▼ some…: Heb. matter of nakedness
▼ divorcement: Heb. cutting off

verses.text_plain: And when she is departed out of his house, she may go and be another man’s wife.
verses.verse_html: 2And when she is departed out of his house, she may go and be another man’s wife.

tokens.text: And when she is departed out

verses.text_plain: And if the latter husband hate her, and write her a bill of divorcement, and giveth it in her hand, and sendeth her out of his house; or if the latter husband die, which took her to be his wife;
verses.verse_html: 3And if the latter husband hate her, and write her a bill of divorcement, and giveth it in her hand, and sendeth her out of his house; or if the latter husband die, which took her to be his wife;

verses.text_plain: Her former husband, which sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife, after that she is defiled; for that is abomination before the Lord: and thou shalt not cause the land to sin, which the Lord thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.
verses.verse_html: 4Her former husband, which sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife, after that she is defiled; for that is abomination before the Lord: and thou shalt not cause the land to sin, which the Lord thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.

tokens.text: and thou shalt not cause the land

verses.text_plain: When a man hath taken a new wife, he shall not go out to war, neither shall he be charged with any business: but he shall be free at home one year, and shall cheer up his wife which he hath taken.
verses.verse_html:
5When a man hath taken a new wife, he shall not go out to war, neither shall he be charged with any business: but he shall be free at home one year, and shall cheer up his wife which he hath taken. ▼
▼ neither…: Heb. not any thing shall pass upon him

footnotes.body_text: ▼ neither…: Heb. not any thing shall pass upon him
footnotes.body_html: ▼ neither…: Heb. not any thing shall pass upon him

verses.text_plain: No man shall take the nether or the upper millstone to pledge: for he taketh a man’s life to pledge.
verses.verse_html: 6No man shall take the nether or the upper millstone to pledge: for he taketh a man’s life to pledge.

verses.text_plain: If a man be found stealing any of his brethren of the children of Israel, and maketh merchandise of him, or selleth him; then that thief shall die; and thou shalt put evil away from among you.
verses.verse_html: 7If a man be found stealing any of his brethren of the children of Israel, and maketh merchandise of him, or selleth him; then that thief shall die; and thou shalt put evil away from among you.

verses.text_plain: Take heed in the plague of leprosy, that thou observe diligently, and do according to all that the priests the Levites shall teach you: as I commanded them, so ye shall observe to do.
verses.verse_html: 8Take heed in the plague of leprosy, that thou observe diligently, and do according to all that the priests the Levites shall teach you: as I commanded them, so ye shall observe to do.

tokens.text: according to all that the priests

verses.text_plain: Remember what the Lord thy God did unto Miriam by the way, after that ye were come forth out of Egypt.
verses.verse_html: 9Remember what the Lord thy God did unto Miriam by the way, after that ye were come forth out of Egypt.

tokens.text: after that ye were come forth

verses.text_plain: When thou dost lend thy brother any thing, thou shalt not go into his house to fetch his pledge.
verses.verse_html:
10When thou dost lend thy brother any thing, thou shalt not go into his house to fetch his pledge. ▼
▼ lend…: Heb. lend the loan of any thing to, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ lend…: Heb. lend the loan of any thing to, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ lend…: Heb. lend the loan of any thing to, etc

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt stand abroad, and the man to whom thou dost lend shall bring out the pledge abroad unto thee.
verses.verse_html: 11Thou shalt stand abroad, and the man to whom thou dost lend shall bring out the pledge abroad unto thee.

verses.text_plain: And if the man be poor, thou shalt not sleep with his pledge:
verses.verse_html: 12And if the man be poor, thou shalt not sleep with his pledge:

verses.text_plain: In any case thou shalt deliver him the pledge again when the sun goeth down, that he may sleep in his own raiment, and bless thee: and it shall be righteousness unto thee before the Lord thy God.
verses.verse_html: 13In any case thou shalt deliver him the pledge again when the sun goeth down, that he may sleep in his own raiment, and bless thee: and it shall be righteousness unto thee before the Lord thy God.

tokens.text: thee: and it shall be righteousness

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt not oppress an hired servant that is poor and needy, whether he be of thy brethren, or of thy strangers that are in thy land within thy gates:
verses.verse_html: 14Thou shalt not oppress an hired servant that is poor and needy, whether he be of thy brethren, or of thy strangers that are in thy land within thy gates:

verses.text_plain: At his day thou shalt give him his hire, neither shall the sun go down upon it; for he is poor, and setteth his heart upon it: lest he cry against thee unto the Lord, and it be sin unto thee.
verses.verse_html:
15At his day thou shalt give him his hire, neither shall the sun go down upon it; for he is poor, and setteth his heart upon it: lest he cry against thee unto the Lord, and it be sin unto thee. ▼
▼ setteth…: Heb. lifteth his soul unto it

footnotes.body_text: ▼ setteth…: Heb. lifteth his soul unto it
footnotes.body_html: ▼ setteth…: Heb. lifteth his soul unto it

verses.text_plain: The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, neither shall the children be put to death for the fathers: every man shall be put to death for his own sin.
verses.verse_html: 16The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, neither shall the children be put to death for the fathers: every man shall be put to death for his own sin.

tokens.text: shall not be put to death

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt not pervert the judgment of the stranger, nor of the fatherless; nor take a widow’s raiment to pledge:
verses.verse_html: 17Thou shalt not pervert the judgment of the stranger, nor of the fatherless; nor take a widow’s raiment to pledge:

verses.text_plain: But thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in Egypt, and the Lord thy God redeemed thee thence: therefore I command thee to do this thing.
verses.verse_html: 18But thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in Egypt, and the Lord thy God redeemed thee thence: therefore I command thee to do this thing.

verses.text_plain: When thou cuttest down thine harvest in thy field, and hast forgot a sheaf in the field, thou shalt not go again to fetch it: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow: that the Lord thy God may bless thee in all the work of thine hands.
verses.verse_html: 19When thou cuttest down thine harvest in thy field, and hast forgot a sheaf in the field, thou shalt not go again to fetch it: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow: that the Lord thy God may bless thee in all the work of thine hands.

tokens.text: it: it shall be for the stranger

verses.text_plain: When thou beatest thine olive tree, thou shalt not go over the boughs again: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
verses.verse_html:
20When thou beatest thine olive tree, thou shalt not go over the boughs again: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow. ▼
▼ go…: Heb. bough it after thee

tokens.text: thou shalt not go over the boughs
it shall be for the stranger

footnotes.body_text: ▼ go…: Heb. bough it after thee
footnotes.body_html: ▼ go…: Heb. bough it after thee

verses.text_plain: When thou gatherest the grapes of thy vineyard, thou shalt not glean it afterward: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
verses.verse_html:
21When thou gatherest the grapes of thy vineyard, thou shalt not glean it afterward: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow. ▼
▼ afterward: Heb. after thee

tokens.text: it shall be for the stranger

footnotes.body_html: ▼ afterward: Heb. after thee

verses.text_plain: And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in the land of Egypt: therefore I command thee to do this thing.
verses.verse_html: 22And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in the land of Egypt: therefore I command thee to do this thing.
